thread.title: Police forced to eject women from nightclub after row about one deleting the other from Facebook
thread.title_full: Police forced to eject women from nightclub after row about one deleting the other from Facebook

author: mirror
title: Police forced to eject women from nightclub after row about one deleting the other from Facebook
text:
News Police forced to eject women from nightclub after row about one deleting the other from Facebook One person responded to a police tweet about the incident: "This is ridiculous. How childish can people be?" Share The women were in a nightclub when the fight broke out (stock photos) (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily     
Women rowing over a Facebook friendship have been ejected from a night club. 
The incident occurred in the early hours of the morning in Gloucester. 
Gloucester City Police said officers were called to the club to intervene and sort out the row, Gloucestershire Live reports. 
The disagreement was sparked by one of the women deleting the other from her friends list on the social media site, police added. Read More 
â€œTwo females have just been removed from a club after a heated argument relating to the one female deleting the other off Facebook," Gloucester City Police tweeted. 
Cheekily, police added an exclamation mark picture after the information. 
The move comes as part of its Street Safe operation on Friday night and Saturday morning. 
It is not known which club in Gloucester that the women were in but they were told to leave. Deleting friends on Facebook can be a controversial move for some users (Photo: Reuters) Read More 
One person responded to police's tweet: "This is ridiculous. How childish can people be? 
"Surely nights out are meant to be fun. 
"this is y I don't do town." Like us on Facebook
